med_condition: Chronic Dehydration, Electrolyte Imbalance (mild to moderate)
drug_interactions: Diuretics (e.g., Furosemide): Risk of severe dehydration, electrolyte derangement.  ACE Inhibitors/ARBs: May exacerbate hypotension or hyperkalemia.
contra_indications: Severe Edema (e.g., pulmonary edema), Congestive Heart Failure (decompensated), Severe Renal Impairment (anuric phase). Not suitable for Geriatric patients

drug_interactions: Calcium Channel Blockers (e.g., Verapamil): Additive bradycardia, AV block.  Beta-Blockers (e.g., Metoprolol): Risk of profound bradycardia, heart block.
contra_indications: Acute Myocardial Infarction, Severe Bradycardia, High-Grade AV Block (without pacemaker).

med_condition: Hemophilia (mild, specific factor deficiencies), Von Willebrand Disease (Type 1)
drug_interactions: Anticoagulants (e.g., Warfarin, Apixaban): Increased risk of thrombosis/clotting.  Antiplatelet Agents (e.g., Aspirin, Clopidogrel): Increased risk of thrombosis due to platelet activation.
contra_indications: Active Thrombosis (e.g., DVT, PE), Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC), History of Hypercoagulable State.

med_condition: Rheumatoid Arthritis (refractory), Crohn's Disease (moderate to severe)
drug_interactions: Other Immunosuppressants (e.g., Methotrexate, Cyclosporine): Increased risk of severe infection, profound immune suppression.  Live Vaccines: Risk of vaccine-induced infection.
contra_indications: Active Severe Infection (bacterial, viral, fungal), Active Malignancy (unless indicated for specific cancers), Severe Immunodeficiency. Not suitable for Geriatric patients

med_condition: Post-Concussion Syndrome (cognitive deficits), Learning Disorders (specific types)
drug_interactions: CNS Stimulants (e.g., Amphetamines): Increased risk of excitotoxicity, seizures.  Antiepileptic Drugs: May alter seizure threshold or reduce efficacy.
contra_indications: Active Seizure Disorder (uncontrolled), Severe Psychosis, Recent Cerebral Hemorrhage. Not suitable for Geriatric patients

drug_interactions: Vitamin A Supplements (high dose): Risk of hypervitaminosis A.  Photosensitizing Drugs (e.g., Tetracyclines): Increased risk of retinal damage from light exposure.
contra_indications: Severe Retinal Detachment (unrepaired), Active Ocular Infection, Severe Allergic Reaction to Ophthalmic Agents.

med_condition: Cystic Fibrosis (thick mucus), Chronic Bronchitis (excessive sputum)
drug_interactions: Antitussives (e.g., Codeine): May lead to mucus plugging due to cough suppression.  Bronchodilators: No direct interaction, but may require dosage adjustment for optimal effect.
contra_indications: Severe Respiratory Insufficiency (with impaired cough reflex), Acute Asthma Exacerbation (if it increases mucus load), Hemoptysis (coughing up blood).

drug_interactions: NSAIDs (e.g., Ibuprofen): Increased risk of acute kidney injury.  Diuretics: Exacerbated fluid and electrolyte disturbances.
contra_indications: End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD, on dialysis), Acute Kidney Injury (severe), Severe Dehydration.

med_condition: Ischemic Stroke (acute phase, neuroprotection), Acute Spinal Cord Injury
drug_interactions: Chemotherapy: Potential for interference with anti-cancer mechanisms.  Immunosuppressants: May reduce efficacy if immune clearance of damaged cells is necessary.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy (unless specifically for cancer therapy), Severe Systemic Infection (if it hinders immune clearance), Uncontrolled Hemorrhage (e.g., hemorrhagic stroke).

drug_interactions: Levothyroxine (Thyroid Hormone): Risk of hyperthyroidism or altered thyroid function tests.  Amiodarone: Can induce thyroid dysfunction (both hyper and hypo).
contra_indications: Untreated Hyperthyroidism (e.g., Graves' Disease), Acute Myocardial Infarction, Adrenal Insufficiency (untreated).

drug_interactions: Statins: Potential for additive effects on lipid profile.  Antihypertensives: May exacerbate hypotension.
contra_indications: Active Hemorrhage (e.g., GI bleed), Severe Hypotension, Aortic Dissection (acute).

drug_interactions: Topical Corticosteroids: May inhibit cellular proliferation.  Topical Antibiotics: No direct interaction, but should address infection first.
contra_indications: Active Skin Infection (bacterial/fungal/viral), Skin Malignancy, Severe Allergic Dermatitis (active).

med_condition: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (Mixed type), Functional Dyspepsia
drug_interactions: Anticholinergics (e.g., Dicyclomine): Antagonistic effects on gut motility.  Opioids: Exacerbation of constipation or reduced motility.
contra_indications: Gastrointestinal Obstruction, Toxic Megacolon, Severe Inflammatory Bowel Disease Flare.

drug_interactions: Other Hepatotoxic Drugs: Increased risk of liver damage.  Warfarin: Altered metabolism, increased bleeding risk.
contra_indications: Acute Fulminant Liver Failure, Uncontrolled Variceal Bleeding, Active Alcohol Use Disorder.

drug_interactions: Statins: Increased risk of myopathy/rhabdomyolysis.  Fibrates: Increased risk of gallstones, myopathy.
contra_indications: Active Gallbladder Disease, Severe Liver Impairment, Severe Muscle Disorder (e.g., rhabdomyolysis).

drug_interactions: Beta-Blockers: May mask symptoms of over-stimulation.  Cardiac Glycosides (e.g., Digoxin): Potential for arrhythmias due to altered cellular energy.
contra_indications: Uncontrolled Arrhythmias, Severe Hypertension, Acute Myocardial Infarction.

med_condition: Parkinson's Disease (motor fluctuations), Restless Legs Syndrome
drug_interactions: Antipsychotics (Dopamine receptor blockers): Reduced efficacy, exacerbated Parkinsonian symptoms.  MAOIs: Risk of hypertensive crisis, serotonin syndrome.
contra_indications: Severe Psychosis, Uncontrolled Hypertension, History of Malignant Hyperthermia.

drug_interactions: Bisphosphonates: May interfere with bone remodeling cycle.  High-dose Calcium/Vitamin D: Risk of hypercalcemia.
contra_indications: Hypercalcemia, Osteosarcoma, Severe Renal Impairment (risk of ectopic calcification).

med_condition: Chronic Otitis Media with Effusion ('glue ear'), Barotrauma (persistent)
drug_interactions: Systemic Decongestants (e.g., Pseudoephedrine): Increased systemic side effects (hypertension, tachycardia).  Antihistamines: Drying effect, may worsen Eustachian tube dysfunction.
contra_indications: Acute Otitis Media (untreated), Perforated Eardrum, Severe Allergic Reaction to Nasal Sprays.

med_condition: Diaphragmatic Paralysis (partial), Respiratory Muscle Weakness (e.g., ALS)
drug_interactions: Muscle Relaxants: Increased respiratory depression.  Opioids: Increased respiratory depression.
contra_indications: Acute Respiratory Failure, Severe COPD with Hypercapnic Respiratory Failure, Myasthenia Gravis (unless specifically indicated).

med_condition: Acute Ischemic Stroke (within window), Acute Myocardial Infarction
drug_interactions: Anticoagulants: Extremely high risk of severe hemorrhage.  Antiplatelet Agents (e.g., Aspirin): High risk of severe hemorrhage.
contra_indications: Active Internal Bleeding, Recent Hemorrhagic Stroke, Uncontrolled Severe Hypertension, Aortic Dissection.

drug_interactions: Alpha-Adrenergic Blockers (e.g., Tamsulosin): Increased risk of hypotension, urinary retention.  Tricyclic Antidepressants: Additive anticholinergic effects.
contra_indications: Urinary Retention (severe), Narrow-Angle Glaucoma, Severe Cardiovascular Disease.

drug_interactions: Systemic Estrogen Therapy: Increased risk of estrogen-related side effects.  Vaginal Antifungals: May alter absorption or efficacy.
contra_indications: Undiagnosed Abnormal Genital Bleeding, Breast Cancer (estrogen-sensitive), Active Vaginal Infection (untreated).

drug_interactions: Intra-articular Corticosteroids: May inhibit cellular repair.  NSAIDs: Can suppress local inflammation needed for repair.
contra_indications: Active Joint Infection, Severe Joint Deformity (non-repairable), Active Malignancy.

drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: May reduce efficacy.  Chemotherapy: Timing critical to avoid antagonism.
contra_indications: Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML), Myelodysplastic Syndrome (high-risk), Active Severe Infection (uncontrolled).

med_condition: Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy (CTE) early stage, Post-Stroke Brain Edema (resolution)
drug_interactions: Osmotic Diuretics: Risk of severe dehydration, electrolyte imbalance.  Corticosteroids: Complex effects on cerebral fluid dynamics.
contra_indications: Active Cerebral Hemorrhage, Severe Intracranial Hypertension (uncontrolled), Severe Dehydration. Not suitable for Geriatric patients

drug_interactions: High-Fluoride Treatments: May interfere with enamel remineralization process.  Acidic Foods/Drinks (excessive): Reduced efficacy.
contra_indications: Active Dental Caries (untreated), Severe Periodontal Disease, Known Allergy to Enamel Proteins.

med_condition: Type 1 Diabetes (early onset, preserving beta cells), Hypoparathyroidism (refractory)
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: May inhibit cell regeneration.  Insulin/Oral Hypoglycemics: Risk of hypoglycemia.
contra_indications: Active Endocrine Tumor (hormone-secreting), Severe Hypoglycemia (uncontrolled), Uncontrolled Diabetes Mellitus.

med_condition: Leaky Gut Syndrome, Irritable Bowel Syndrome (with barrier dysfunction)
drug_interactions: NSAIDs: May disrupt barrier function.  PPIs: Altered gut microbiome.
contra_indications: Gastrointestinal Obstruction, Severe Active Inflammatory Bowel Disease (toxic megacolon), Severe Food Allergies.

med_condition: Sickle Cell Anemia (to improve blood flow), Peripheral Arterial Disease (microcirculation)
drug_interactions: Anticoagulants: Increased bleeding risk in microvasculature.  Antiplatelet Agents: Increased bleeding risk.
contra_indications: Acute Hemorrhage (e.g., cerebral hemorrhage), Severe Thrombocytopenia, DIC.

med_condition: Cytokine Storm Syndrome, Severe Allergic Reactions (anaphylaxis - adjunct)
drug_interactions: Corticosteroids (high dose): Increased risk of severe immunosuppression.  Other Immunomodulators: Complex and unpredictable immune effects.
contra_indications: Active Severe Infection (uncontrolled), Severe Immunodeficiency, Active Malignancy.

drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: Direct antagonism.  Live Vaccines: Increased risk of vaccine-induced infection.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy (lymphoid cancers), Autoimmune Diseases (active flare), Organ Transplant Recipients.

drug_interactions: Broad-Spectrum Antifungals: May interfere with immune mechanism.  Immunosuppressants: Reduced efficacy.
contra_indications: Autoimmune Diseases, Severe Allergic Reactions to Fungi (e.g., allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis), Active Systemic Infection (bacterial/viral).

med_condition: Chronic Kidney Disease (fibrosis), Alport Syndrome (slowing progression)
drug_interactions: NSAIDs: Increased risk of kidney injury.  ACE Inhibitors/ARBs: May exacerbate hyperkalemia or hypotension.
contra_indications: End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD), Acute Kidney Injury (anuric), Severe Hyperkalemia.

drug_interactions: SSRIs/SNRIs: Risk of serotonin syndrome.  Benzodiazepines: Increased sedation, respiratory depression.
contra_indications: Severe Depression (with suicidal ideation), Active Seizure Disorder, Severe Liver Impairment.

med_condition: Multiple Sclerosis (relapsing-remitting, for repair), Transverse Myelitis
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: May inhibit remyelination.  Corticosteroids: Complex effects on CNS cells and myelin.
contra_indications: Active Brain Tumor, Severe CNS Infection, History of Primary Progressive MS (refractory).

med_condition: Critical Limb Ischemia, Chronic Wound Healing (hypoxic wounds)
drug_interactions: Vasodilators (e.g., Nitrates): Exacerbated hypotension.  Anticoagulants: Increased bleeding risk in ischemic tissues.
contra_indications: Acute Hemorrhage, Severe Hypotension, Uncontrolled Hypertension.

med_condition: Pancreatitis (chronic, to reduce inflammation), Type 1 Diabetes (autoimmune component)
drug_interactions: Corticosteroids: Additive immunosuppression, increased risk of infection.  Other Anti-inflammatories: Increased risk of gastrointestinal side effects.
contra_indications: Active Pancreatitis (acute flare), Pancreatic Cancer (unresectable), Severe Immunodeficiency. Not suitable for Geriatric patients

drug_interactions: NSAIDs: Increased risk of gastrointestinal bleeding.  Corticosteroids: Additive immunosuppression, increased side effects.
contra_indications: Active Bacterial Pericarditis, Severe Coagulopathy, Recent Cardiac Surgery (risk of tamponade).

med_condition: Degenerative Disc Disease (early to moderate), Disc Herniation (non-surgical)
drug_interactions: NSAIDs (long-term): May inhibit healing.  Oral Steroids: Impaired connective tissue repair.
contra_indications: Acute Spinal Cord Compression, Cauda Equina Syndrome, Active Spinal Infection.

drug_interactions: Chemotherapy: Potential for accelerated cell growth in cancer.  Immunosuppressants: Reduced immune surveillance.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy, Severe Autoimmune Disease (active flare), Severe Proliferative Disorders.

drug_interactions: Oral Contraceptives: Altered hormonal balance.  Anticoagulants: Increased risk of abnormal uterine bleeding.
contra_indications: Undiagnosed Abnormal Genital Bleeding, Endometrial Cancer, Active Thrombotic Disorders.

drug_interactions: Diuretics: May mask underlying venous stasis.  Anticoagulants: Increased bleeding risk.
contra_indications: Acute Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT), Severe Arterial Insufficiency, Active Leg Ulcer (unmanaged).

drug_interactions: Corticosteroids (local injection): Tendon/ligament weakening.  NSAIDs: May inhibit healing.
contra_indications: Acute Laryngitis (active infection), Vocal Cord Malignancy, Recent Vocal Cord Surgery (early healing phase).

drug_interactions: Chemotherapy: Potential for altered efficacy.  Corticosteroids: Complex effects on adipose tissue.
contra_indications: Cachexia/Severe Malnutrition, Active Cancer (unless specific indication), Pregnancy.

med_condition: Shift Work Sleep Disorder, Delayed Sleep Phase Syndrome
drug_interactions: Sedatives: Increased drowsiness.  Alcohol: Potentiates sedative effects.
contra_indications: Severe Liver Impairment, Acute Narrow-Angle Glaucoma, Heavy Machinery Operation.

drug_interactions: Chemotherapy: Potential for anti-cancer interference.  Immunosuppressants: May reduce efficacy.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy (unless indicated for specific cancers), Severe Infection (if it hinders immune clearance), Pregnancy.

drug_interactions: Topical Corticosteroids (long-term high potency): Skin thinning.  Systemic Retinoids: Increased skin dryness.
contra_indications: Active Skin Infection (bacterial/fungal/viral), Severe Allergic Contact Dermatitis, Large Area of Broken Skin.

med_condition: Chronic Neuropathic Pain (glial activation), Seizure Disorders (glial excitability)
drug_interactions: Antiepileptic Drugs: Potential for altered seizure threshold.  Opioids: Altered pain perception.
contra_indications: Not suitable for Geriatric patients. Active Brain Tumor, Severe CNS Infection, Acute Brain Hemorrhage.

drug_interactions: Osmotic Diuretics: Additive dehydration, electrolyte imbalance.  Corticosteroids: Complex effects on cerebral fluid dynamics.
contra_indications: Acute Cerebral Hemorrhage, Severe Intracranial Hypertension (uncontrolled), Severe Dehydration.

drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: Direct antagonism.  Live Vaccines: Increased risk of vaccine-induced infection.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy (B-cell lymphoma/leukemia), Autoimmune Diseases (active flare), Organ Transplant Recipients.

drug_interactions: Diuretics: Potential for dehydration, electrolyte imbalance.  Anticoagulants: Increased bleeding risk.
contra_indications: Active Cellulitis (uncontrolled), Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT), Congestive Heart Failure (decompensated).

type_classification: Type II Muscle Fiber Hypertrophy Agent
drug_interactions: Corticosteroids: Can lead to muscle wasting.  Anabolic Steroids: Potential for severe side effects.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy, Severe Cardiovascular Disease, Liver Impairment (severe).

med_condition: Peripheral Neuropathy (severe nerve damage), Diabetic Neuropathy (painful, sensory loss)
drug_interactions: Opioids: Reduced pain perception, masking nerve regeneration.  Antidepressants (TCAs, SNRIs): Potential for additive neuropathy.
contra_indications: Acute Nerve Compression (unrelieved), Active Nerve Trauma, Severe Neuropathic Pain (exacerbation).

drug_interactions: Systemic Steroids: Altered neurogenesis.  Topical Nasal Steroids: Potential for mucosal thinning.
contra_indications: Active Nasal Infection, Brain Tumor (affecting olfactory bulb), Severe Head Trauma (acute).

drug_interactions: Alcohol: Direct pancreatic toxicity.  Gallstone-forming drugs: Increased risk of pancreatitis.
contra_indications: Acute Pancreatitis (active, severe), Pancreatic Cancer (unresectable), Severe Gallstone Disease (obstructive).

med_condition: Recurrent Pneumonia (immunocompromised), Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) infections
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: Inhibits macrophage function.  Corticosteroids: Suppresses inflammation and macrophage activity.
contra_indications: Active Pulmonary Infection (bacterial/fungal/viral), Autoimmune Pulmonary Disorders, Severe Respiratory Failure.

med_condition: Primary Ciliary Dyskinesia (PCD), Chronic Rhinosinusitis (mucociliary dysfunction)
drug_interactions: Nasal Decongestants: Drying effect, ciliary impairment.  Antihistamines: Drying effect.
contra_indications: Acute Nasal Infection, Severe Nasal Septal Perforation, History of Severe Allergic Reaction to Nasal Sprays.

med_condition: Central Hypoventilation Syndrome, High-Altitude Pulmonary Edema (preventative)
drug_interactions: Opioids: Increased respiratory depression.  Sedatives: Increased respiratory depression.
contra_indications: Acute Respiratory Failure, Severe COPD with CO2 retention (paradoxical effect), Severe Neurological Conditions Affecting Respiration.

med_condition: Primary Hypogonadism (male), Androgen Deficiency in Aging Males (ADAM)
drug_interactions: Exogenous Testosterone: Risk of supraphysiological levels, feedback inhibition.  GnRH Analogs: May interfere with hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis.
contra_indications: Prostate Cancer (active or history), Male Breast Cancer, Severe Liver Impairment, Sleep Apnea (severe).

med_condition: Interstitial Cystitis (pain reduction), Recurrent UTIs (adherence prevention)
drug_interactions: Urinary Alkalinizers: May alter efficacy.  Antibiotics: No direct interaction, but should treat active infection.
contra_indications: Active Urinary Tract Infection (untreated), Severe Bladder Outlet Obstruction, Known Allergy to Urinary Antiseptics.

drug_interactions: Statins: Potential for additive effects on plaque.  Antihypertensives: May exacerbate hypotension.
contra_indications: Acute Aortic Dissection, Severe Uncontrolled Hypertension, Active Internal Bleeding.

drug_interactions: Systemic Muscle Relaxants: Increased laryngeal muscle weakness.  Botulinum Toxin Injections: Additive paralysis.
contra_indications: Vocal Cord Paralysis (unilateral/bilateral), Acute Laryngitis (active infection), Severe Respiratory Distress.

med_condition: Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia (CAH), Cushing's Syndrome (mild, non-tumor)
drug_interactions: Systemic Corticosteroids: Altered hormonal balance.  Enzyme Inducers/Inhibitors: Altered drug metabolism.
contra_indications: Adrenal Carcinoma, Acute Adrenal Crisis, Severe Liver Impairment.

med_condition: Paget's Disease of Bone, Atypical Femur Fractures (recurrent)
drug_interactions: Bisphosphonates: Altered bone remodeling.  Calcitonin: Reduced efficacy.
contra_indications: Osteosarcoma, Hypercalcemia (uncontrolled), Severe Renal Impairment.

med_condition: Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA) prevention, Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (vasospasm prevention)
drug_interactions: Anticoagulants: Increased risk of cerebral hemorrhage.  Antihypertensives (excessive): Risk of cerebral hypoperfusion.
contra_indications: Acute Hemorrhagic Stroke, Uncontrolled Severe Hypertension, Cerebral Aneurysm (unrepaired).

drug_interactions: Acidic Mouth Rinses: Reduced efficacy.  High-abrasive Toothpastes: Removal of protective layer.
contra_indications: Active Dental Caries (untreated), Pulpitis (irreversible), Severe Periodontal Disease.

med_condition: Genetic Deficiency Disorders (e.g., G6PD Deficiency, certain enzyme deficiencies)
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: Essential to prevent immune rejection of gene therapy vectors.  Chemotherapy: Potential for altered efficacy.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy (unless specifically for cancer gene therapy), Severe Autoimmune Disease, Pregnancy (if teratogenic).

drug_interactions: Anticholinergics: Antagonism of prokinetic effect.  Opioids: Exacerbated constipation, reduced motility.
contra_indications: Gastrointestinal Obstruction, Ileus, Active Severe Gastrointestinal Bleeding.

med_condition: Primary Biliary Cholangitis (PBC), Hypercholesterolemia (refractory to statins)
drug_interactions: Fat-Soluble Vitamins (A, D, E, K): Reduced absorption.  Warfarin: Reduced absorption, altered INR.
contra_indications: Complete Biliary Obstruction, Severe Hypertriglyceridemia (risk of pancreatitis), Severe Constipation.

med_condition: Chronic Viral Infections (e.g., CMV, EBV), Immunodeficiency Disorders (NK cell dysfunction)
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: Direct antagonism.  Live Vaccines: Increased risk of vaccine-induced illness.
contra_indications: Active Autoimmune Disease (severe flare), Active Malignancy (NK cell leukemia), Organ Transplant Recipients (risk of rejection).

med_condition: IgA Deficiency, Recurrent Respiratory Tract Infections (gut-immune axis)
drug_interactions: Oral Antibiotics: Disruption of gut microbiome.  Immunosuppressants: Reduced efficacy.
contra_indications: Severe Inflammatory Bowel Disease (active flare), Gastrointestinal Obstruction, Severe Immunodeficiency.

drug_interactions: Muscle Relaxants: Increased respiratory depression, profound weakness.  Aminoglycoside Antibiotics: Increased neuromuscular blockade.
contra_indications: Acute Respiratory Failure, Severe Myasthenia Gravis Crisis, Known Allergy to Cholinesterase Inhibitors.

med_condition: Peripheral Nerve Trauma, Brachial Plexus Injury
drug_interactions: Corticosteroids (high dose): Impaired nerve healing.  NSAIDs: May delay nerve regeneration.
contra_indications: Active Nerve Compression (unrelieved), Active Nerve Infection, Severe Autoimmune Neuropathy (active flare).

med_condition: Adrenoleukodystrophy (X-linked, early), Multiple Sclerosis (primary progressive, adjunctive)
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: May inhibit beneficial cellular activity.  Chemotherapy: Potential for altered efficacy.
contra_indications: Active Brain Tumor, Severe CNS Infection, History of Rapidly Progressive MS.

drug_interactions: Sedatives: Increased cerebral hypoperfusion.  Vasodilators (excessive): Risk of cerebral steal phenomenon.
contra_indications: Acute Cerebral Hemorrhage, Severe Intracranial Hypertension, Acute Ischemic Stroke (unstable).

med_condition: Type 1 Diabetes (newly diagnosed, for beta cell preservation), Autoimmune Pancreatitis
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: Essential for autoimmune conditions.  Insulin/Oral Hypoglycemics: Risk of hypoglycemia.
contra_indications: Active Severe Infection (uncontrolled), Active Malignancy, Severe Immunodeficiency.

drug_interactions: NSAIDs: Increased risk of gastrointestinal bleeding.  Corticosteroids: Additive immunosuppression, increased side effects.
contra_indications: Not suitable for geriatric patients. Acute Pericarditis (infectious), Pericardial Tamponade, Severe Coagulopathy.

med_condition: Multiple Sclerosis (spinal cord lesions), Transverse Myelitis (chronic)
drug_interactions: Immunosuppressants: May inhibit myelin repair.  Corticosteroids: Complex effects on CNS cells and myelin.
contra_indications: Active Spinal Cord Compression, Severe Spinal Infection, Active Spinal Cord Tumor.

drug_interactions: Chemotherapy: Potential for interference with anti-cancer mechanisms.  Immunosuppressants: Reduced immune surveillance.
contra_indications: Active Malignancy, Severe Autoimmune Disease, Severe Proliferative Disorders.

drug_interactions: Hormonal Contraceptives: Altered hormonal balance, potential for reduced efficacy.  NSAIDs: Reduced efficacy if inflammation is primary cause.
contra_indications: Undiagnosed Abnormal Genital Bleeding, Uterine Malignancy, Pregnancy.

drug_interactions: Calcium Channel Blockers: Additive hypotensive effects.  Alpha-Blockers: Increased risk of profound hypotension.
contra_indications: Severe Hypotension, Acute Myocardial Infarction, Severe Valvular Heart Disease (e.g., aortic stenosis).

med_condition: Vocal Fold Atrophy, Presbyphonia (age-related voice change)
drug_interactions: Systemic Steroids: Potential for vocal cord atrophy.  Muscle Relaxants: Reduced vocal cord tension.
contra_indications: Acute Laryngitis (active infection), Vocal Cord Malignancy, Recent Vocal Cord Surgery (early healing phase).
